result.execSummary:
The defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

Participate in any treatment deemed appropriate including Anger Management

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cesar Jaimes-Puebla

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $51 witness fees for witness Mario G. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25478204 in court 3x on 12/16/15, 12/17/15, 12/18/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Mario G. was approved for 3 appearances on 12/16/15, 12/17/15, 12/18/15 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Mario G. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf
3/9/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  On the same day at the hour of the Jury returned and by their foreperson brought in a verdict which was then and there read by the Court as follows:  We, the jury, find the defendant, Cesa Jaimes-Puebla, guilty of DISORDERLY CONDUCT, as charged in the criminal complaint.  Answer the following question:  The jury has not filled it in.  
The Court, the clerk polled the Jury and each Juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict is approved by the Court and filed.  Court discharged the Jury.  State moves for Judgment of Conviction on the verdict.  Defense moves for Judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court grants State's motion and orders Judgment of Conviction be entered on the verdict.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled on January 28, 2016 at 1:30 pm.
Sworn as interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez and Alexandra Wirth.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense motion for a directed verdict is denied by the Court.  The defendant advised the Court that he will testify.  Court began colloquy with defendant about his right to/not to testify.  Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to remain silent.  Jury in box at 8:59 am.  Sworn for defense:  Sasar J.-P. and Martin S.  Exhibit 5 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 10:15 am.  Jury instructions discussed.  Jury in box at 11:05 am.  Recalled (previously sworn):  Sasar J.P.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court instructed the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 12:06 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy A. Cleveland who was duly sworn for that purpose.
Sworn as interpreter:  Leisl Monroy, Dawn Maldonado and Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury in box at 1:56 pm.  Sworn for the state:  Francisco S. Exhibit 3 offered and received.  Sworn for the state:  Mario G.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 3:24 pm.  Exhibit 4 offered and received.  Jury in box at 3:41 pm.  Defense reserves all motions until the conclusion of the trial.  Sworn for defense:  Juan G., Salvador C., Pablo A. and Roberto M.-J.  Jury released at 4:40 pm.  Case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 21.  Jury trial scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado, Sarah Guzman and Lynn Leazar.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  In chambers discussion put on the record.  Jury in box at 9:36 am.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Martin S.  Jury out of box at 11:11 am.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.  Jury in box at 11:31 am.  Sworn for the state:  Jasmine G.  Jury released for lunch at 11:49 am.  Exhibit 2 offered and received.  Case adjourned to 1:15 pm for continued jury trial in Branch 21.
Sworn as interpreters:  Alejandra Klaric and Liesl Monroy.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties discussed possible stipulation.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:18 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn at 4:38 pm.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 21.  Jury trial scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed until 10:30 pm.
Sworn as interpreter:  Alejandra Klaric.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  This court will be proceeding with another trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter:  Yvon Roustan.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  The State is ready to proceed.  Defense advised the court that there may be a discovery issue.  Court advised parties that this matter will be proceeding to trial today.  Court ordered case passed.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel waived the appearance of the interpreter for this hearing only.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on October 7, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br.24.vb
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Martin S., Jasmine G., Francisco S., Mario G. and the Rainbow Park

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.vb

Defendant Cesar Jaimes-Puebla in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 06-04-2015 at 01:30pm
